newsitem.title: USA: US LPG market steady to weaker in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: US LPG market steady to weaker in quiet trade.

text.p: U.S. spot liquefied petroleum gas prices were steady to slightly weaker in extremely quiet trade Tuesday following the Memorial Day holiday and the sharp drop in NYMEX crude oil futures.
"We are weaker to unchanged in sympathy with the Merc," said a trader in Houston. "Few deals are getting done. Buyers don't want to buy but sellers want to get rid of what they can."
In the Mont Belvieu, Texas, Gulf Coast hub, spot propane was a quarter cent weaker at between 35.25 cents and 35.50 cents a gallon. A small parcel for 35.50 cents traded hands.
Prices in Conway, Kansas, were steady, with a small deal traded at 37.50 cents.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
